creator: adrian.bala@gmail.com
text:
Missing comment control which would be visible just in Listeners.

For now I have to use empty request for that or use __log() function in context of http request but would be easier to have a dedicated Comment component that might be use to better describe the test plan itself.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
I don't understand what you are asking for here.

There is already a comment field on the Test Plan and on Listeners (indeed on just about all test elements).

What have comments got to do with logging and Listeners?

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text: I think what is requested is a Log Sampler that would log a message conifgured in sampler.

Hi Guys,

let me try to explain it this way.

In some TestPlans I have many similar requests which could be group in blocks.

...
+block1 // Now I am testing block 1
  + GET: request 1
  + GET: request 2
  + ...
+block2 // Now I am testing block 2
  + GET: request 1
  + GET: request 2
  + ...
...

I would like to be able to add some comments visible in Tree Listener which I realize with some extra empty requests but would be easier as shown below

...
+block1
  + Now I am testing block 1
  + GET: request 1
  + GET: request 2
  + ...
+block2
  + Now I am testing block 2
  + GET: request 1
  + GET: request 2
  + ...
...

Is it the idea clearer now or I need to add the screenshot tomorrow? Or maybe there is other way to do that with no requests but I simply do not know it? I would be grateful for any constructive TIPs how to realize it easier.
creator: adrian.bala@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text: You can use the Java Request sampler to generate a sample which will appear in the results tree. Just use a suitable label.
